General Takaki.name: General Takaki

rulings.text: If multiple replacement effects are applied to the same permanent, that permanent's controller decides the order that they apply. in particular that means you can apply General Takaki's ability before any abilities that add or double damage apply.

General Takaki's ability works unintuitively with trample. Lethal damage is determined by the amount of damage a creature assigns (usually with its power) and not the amount of damage it will deal due to replacement effects. If you attack with a 1/1 trampler it will deal 3 damage to its blocker and no damage to the defending player.

Ginjiro Chimei.name: Ginjiro Chimei

rulings.text: If an effect moves a card that is copying another card from your graveyard and then asks for the characteristics of that card (for example: Revive), it will use the characteristics of the card it was copying.

If a card that is copying another card leaves the graveyard, it will stop being a copy of that card. For example, if you copy a card with Conjure with Ginjiro's ability and attempt to cast that card, it will no longer have conjure as you attempt to pay for it and thus the casting would be illegal. If it is illegal, that card will remain in your graveyard and still be copying the other card. If for some reason you are still able to cast that card (for example: it's a different card with Conjure) you will cast it as that card rather than the card it was a copy of.

If the copied creature has an ability that moves it from the graveyard to the battlefield (for example: Unearth), the card will attempt to enter the battlefield no longer as a copy of that card. If it is not a permanent card, it will remain in your graveyard.

Spirit Script.name: Spirit Script

rulings.text: If Spirit Script becomes a copy of a card and then leaves the graveyard, it will stop being a copy of the card. For example, if Spirit Script becomes a copy of a spell with flashback and you attempt to cast it for its flashback cost, it will no longer have flashback as you attempt to pay for the spell and thus the casting would be illegal. If it is illegal, Spirit Script will remain in your graveyard and still be copying the other card. If for some reason you are still able to cast Spirit Script anyway, you will cast it as Spirit Script rather than the card it was a copy of.

If an effect moves a Spirit Script that is copying a card from your graveyard and then asks for characteristics of that card (for example: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was an instant, draw a card.) it will use the characteristics of the card Spirit Script was copying.

Spirit Script.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
